question: 1. Traversal of a graph is different from tree because _________.

answers.a: There can be loops in the graph so we must maintain a visited flag for every vertex
answers.b: Depth first travesal of a graph uses queue whereas traversal of tree uses queue
answers.c: Breadth first traversal of a tree is not possible

question: 2. Breadth First Traversal of a tree can be used for _________.

answers.a: Finding the shortest distance to every other node from the root in the tree
answers.c: Finding strongly connected components in the tree

question: 3. What is common in three different types of traversals (Inorder, Preorder and Postorder)?

answers.a: Root is visited after the left subtree
answers.b: Root is visited before the right subtree
answers.c: Left subtree is always visited before the right subtree

question: 4. A binary tree can be uniquely re-constructed from ________.
5. The inorder and preorder traversal of a binary tree are d b e a f c g and a b d e c f g, respectively. The postorder traversal of the binary tree is _________.

answers.a: e d b g f c a
answers.b: d e f g b c a
answers.c: d e b f g c a
answers.d: d e b f g a c
